venue.name: Trinity College Life Sciences Center Auditorium

item.description:
Join international film buffs as well as Spanish language speakers and learners at Trinity College's free weekly showings of Iberian and Latin American films.

This week's film is THE HOLY GIRL Directed by Lucrecia Martel (Argintina, 2004)
ENT physicians gather at a provincial hotel in Salta. The hotel owner, Helena, is subdued, brittle, avoiding the calls of her ex-husband's pregnant wife. Family dysfunction seems everywhere. Helena's daughter, Amalia, about 14, discusses vocations in a Catholic girls group. Their teen imaginations conflate the erotic, the religious, and the lurid. Amalia notices Dr. Jano, and he notices her. She decides to make him her vocation, she follows him, he rubs against her in a public crowd, he's appalled at his actions. Meanwhile, Helena believes Jano is attracted to her even through he's married. Longing, guilt, scandal, and teen sensuality are set to collide.

Film starts at 7:00 in the Life Sciences Building.
For directions to Trinity, please visit http://www.trincoll.e...
Or call (860) 297-2053.

For campus map, see:
http://www.trincoll.e...

If you can come earlier than 6:30, please join me for supper in the Cave cafeteria (basement of Mather Hall, no id required). I'll be there by 6:00.

group.name: The Hartford Spanish Language Meetup Group

item.name: Film: The Holy Girl
